page.title: 13Traffic Problems, Turvey
page.content: In 1984 the A428 had an average daily traffic flow of 6450, 18% are heavy goods vehicles. The road is fairly straight within the village, speeds are high despite the limit, yetthere are many concealed entrances and footpaths are narrow. Those who live on the main road have to tolerate the noise and suction of passing traffic, fear of vehicles mounting the pavement and the hazard for car owners of entering or leaving their homes. Spray from the salt and rain blackens the walls and windows and erodes stone walls and paintwork. The Parish Council have a Road Safety Committee. A By-pass is being considered for after 1991, whilst aware of the benefit of this, they have recently been considering the disadvantagesto some, such as loss of trade to businesses.
